node.title: CST_Storage_17
node.doctext:
This is a storage node for CST reviews. Reviews are moved her from our working area in [CST_Chat].

This archive begins on 09/18/05, When it's full we'll move to [CST_Storage_18].

See also CST Storage collabs [CST_Storage_1|1] - [CST_Storage_17|17].

-----------Batch Processed 09/18/05 (part 2) by [GrouchyOldMan]------

Writeup Title:[Thank You (Falettinme Be Mice Elf Agin)]
Author:[pingouin]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 68%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2005.9.15@5:19 [Simulacron3] says [Thank You (Falettinme Be Mice Elf Agin)]
Hello pingouin, Unfortunately because if the [E2 copyright changes] this can no longer stay in the database. If you would like to update it and resubmit it you may want to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material |FAQ] for suggestions and ideas.

Writeup Title:[Four Quartets]
Author:[ehud]
Reviewer: [lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 31%
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: Hello ehud, This is a very nice reactionary piece to Eliot’s work:) It’s been reviewed by the [CST_Group] and is compliant. If you would like to you can append this hardlink [CST Approved] . There are a significant number of typos and this really needs to be run through a spell checker. You may also want to include that the quartets were first published separately between 1935 and 1942 in your write up for the purposes of meeting fair use.

Writeup Title:[The Boy in the Bubble]
Author:[Goldenboy26]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: Cited lyrics are 330 words.
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2005.9.15@1:01 [GrouchyOldMan] says 2005.09.14 at 01:42 [dannye] says [The Boy in the Bubble] doesn't seem to comply. I told the user. Not sure if he'll respond to me.
Hello Goldenboy26, Unfortunately the lyrics you have cited in this write up are 330 words and in order for it to meet fair use there can be no more than 250. You may want to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for some suggestions and ideas. If you have any questions I will be more than happy to assist. If I don’t hear from you by next [September 21,2005|Wednesday] I’ll assume you don’t want to update it and it will be removed.
After some clarifications about fair use I received the following msg from the user" 2005.9.19@22:15 Goldenboy26 says Lometa my write up got cut while I was waiting for permission from the publisher."
I replied, "That's okay. You can wait until you get the go-ahead from the copyright holder and repost it or resubmit it now so that it meets fair use and update it later with all the lyrics when you get permission."

Writeup Title:[Hurricane Katrina]
Author:[avalyn]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 03%
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2005.9.10@2:21 [GrouchyOldMan] says 2005.9.9 (1.3 hr) [avalyn] says When you get a spare minute, would you mind perusing my [Hurricane Katrina] writeup? It contains some lyrical excerpts, but they're well within the fair use policy. I just want to put the "CST Approved" bit.
Hello avalyn, First please accept my deepest condolences for your loss. [Hurricane Katrina] has been reviewed and passes with flying colors. You may add the hardlink [CST Approved].

Compliance Assessment: Yes
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2005.9.5 (8.1 min) borgo says hey Bill, hope all is well with you and yours - I hope to home on my own later this week - could you or one of your co-horts in the CST bunch take a look at my effort in City of New Orleans - thanks...
Love the song, love the writeup. This one is [CST Approved|Good to go] Please add the [CST Approved] tag if you like, and get well soonest!
Tc = 1652, Tq = 310, %q= 19%

Writeup Title: [Jane, you ignorant slut!]

Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]

Compliance Assessment: No
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2005.9.6 (1.1 hr) JohnnyGoodyear says OK, Jane, you ignorant slut! is pretty much cut and paste to start with, albeit from the noted fan site, but do we think these scripts are copyright?
2005.9.9 (36.6 min) [riverrun] says "Note that site (cited) is not affiliated with SNL. A script is the property of the person who wrote it until it's bought, at which point--in this case--it belongs to SNL, NBC, whomever." So these are clearly non-compliant.

Original Author's Permission received?: No
Quoted content less than 33%: No
Compliance Assessment: Yes
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2005.8.25 [GrouchyOldMan] says to the author: Nicely done, I considered noding this myself and I'm pleased to see it here. If you add a proper citation for the document and indicate that the quoted content is within the [Public Domain], you can add the [CST Approved]. If you promise to keep it updated as the constitution is finalized, I'll gladly C! it. Cheers.

Writeup Title:[Iko Iko]
Author:[Fuzzy and Blue]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: [Grateful Dead lyrics|Yes]
Quoted content less than 33%: NA
Compliance Assessment:
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2005.8.19@6:06 [Simulacron3] says [Iko Iko] by [Fuzzy and Blue] is liner notes.
Hello Fuzzy and Blue, This write up has been submitted to [Content_Salvage] for review. The write up under [Grateful Dead lyrics] gives E2 permission to host them as long as Ice Nine Publishing is credited. I am assuming that their liberal copyright policy includes linear notes. [Blues for Allah] has a nice example. Please let me know when you’ve added the credit and I’ll give you the okay dokey for a CST tag.
2005.9.2@6:54 [fuzzy and blue] says I killed [Iko Iko] myself; perhaps someday I will repost with appropriate permissions but since I don't know when that someday is I figure it's best not to risk getting e2 in trouble.

Writeup Title:[unknown]
Author:[Junkill]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: Unknown)
Original Author's Permission received?: Contingent
Quoted content less than 33%: NA
Compliance Assessment: NA
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:

2005.8.23@23:46 [Junkill] says Hey copyright folks: I am thrilled, the copyright holder of a song has written me back. She asks several questions, most of which I can answer, two which left me baffled. 1) "any security features in place to protect copyrighted material posted on the site" .. 2) "amount of time lyrics would be available on the site" which is, I suppose, indefinitely ... I want to do this right, and it is exciting to me that they wrote back. Can you help?

What a thrill! I’m not sure what the copyright holder means by security features. You may want to write her back and ask for more details. Because you have permission the amount of time they would be available would be up to you as the author of the write up as well as the original copyright holder. For example if she says the lyrics can be available for 4 weeks then you could post them here and then per your agreement make a deletion request.

One way to work around these issues would be to do a little interview with her about the background of the song. As long as your original work exceeds two thirds of the lyrics posted then your write up can stay for as long as you want it to under the guidelines of [fair use]. For more specifics you may want to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material]. When you are ready to subit the write up message [Content_Salvage] again and request a [CST Approved] tag. –[Lometa|lo].

Hello borgo, This write up has been reviewed and is compliant. You may append this hardlink [CST Approved] . Thank you!

Writeup Title:[WordPress]
Author:[Cooz]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: Unknown
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 94%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2005.8.1@2:00 [GrouchyOldMan] says [dannye] says I think [WordPress] might be a c/p violation.
Hello Cooz, Because of the [E2 copyright changes] there has to have some sort of verification that the information copied and pasted into the database meets the requirements discussed in the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] . There are several suggestions to consider such as contacting the author and asking for permission or adding more original content to meet fair use. If you have any questions I’d be more than happy to help. If I don’t hear from you by next [August 10|Wednesdy] I’ll assume you don’t want to keep the write up and it will be removed.
Hello again Cooz, It’s been over a week since this was reported to the [Content-Salvage] team. Unfortunately we can’t leave possible copyrighted material in the database indefinitely. If you would like to update and resubmit this write up and have any questions please feel free to msg me or [GrouchyOldMan].

Writeup Title: [End of the World]
Author: [Pseudo_Intellectual]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: No
Original Author's Permission received?: No
Quoted content less than 33%: No
Compliance Assessment: Yes
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: [Pseudo_Intellectual] says ...If you prefer, however, tracing the indented fragments in [End of the World] could make a more demanding puzzle.
/msg [Pseudo_Intellectual] Re. [End of the World]: Okay, I took the bait and reviewed this one as well. First off, I want you to know that I dig this poem! I get what you are saying, and I like the way that you're saying it. Upvote for sure. However, I'm not sure it's copyright compliant. Assuming that there's no Public Domain content in there, and that all the indented and italicized bits are quoted, I'm seeing 43% quoted, higher than the [E2 Copyright Changes|E2 copyright policy] threshold for fair use. Without knowing the specific source for each quote, I can't say one way or another whether it's compliant or not. How would you like to proceed?
2005.07.12 at 05:49 [Pseudo_Intellectual] says You may have noticed I haven't been around much lately; still, in the face of crisis, I've done a bit of analysis on End of the World and now after crunching the following numbers you can tell me precisely which limb needs to be amputated for the patient to survive 8)
Breakdown -- Original text by me without samples (before bibliography): 1,058 words; Bibliography + notes: 139 words (that makes for ... 1097 total?); Source 1 (emergency feeding): 138 words; Source 2 (Bible): 244 words; Source 3 (Freud): 178 words; Source 4 (can't find any quotes... may have been otherwise inspirational 8); Source 5 (Mental Domination): 119 words; Source 6 (dictionary): 33 words; Source 7 (thesaurus): 58 words; Source 8 (Chinese Poetry): 146 words; Source 9 (Gulf War): 67 words; Source 10 (painting): no words -- was visual inspiration 8)
[GrouchyOldMan] Says: After receiving detailed info on the quoted materials used in this piece I believe that it is compliant under the E2 copyright policy.
Tc = 2249, Tq1 = 138, Tq2 = 244, Tq3 = 178, Tq4 = 119, Tq5 = 33, Tq6 = 58, Tq7 = 146, Tq8 = 67, %q1= 6%, %q2= 11%, %q3= 8%, %q4= 5%, %q5= 2%, %q6= 3%, %q7= 7%, %q8= 3%

You may want to read through [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for suggestions and ideas. If you have any questions I would be more than happy to help. If I don't hear from you by next [July 9,2005|Sunday] I'll assume you don't want to keep it and it will be removed. [lometa|Lo].
No reply from the user. Write up removed.

Writeup Title:[Nymphet]
Author:[Ikura]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 10%: 44% 32%
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2005.6.29@13:17 [GrouchyOldMan] says 2005.6.28 (9.3 hr) [JohnnyGoodyear] says Hey trouble :) I like Ikura plenty but [Nymphet] may need its number balance added to. They can surely do it.
Hello Ikura, Unfortunately there is not enough original content in this write up to meet fair use. As it stands now the quoted piece is 44% and to be copyright compliant it cannot exceed 10%. You may want to read through [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material]for suggestions and ideas. If you have any questions I would be more than happy to help. If I don’t hear from you by next [July 9, 2005|Sunday] I’ll assume you don’t want to keep it and it will be removed.

2005.7.2@23:47 [Ikura] says [Nymphet] - I think you're misreading the 10% standard, that's supposed to be no more than 10% of the quoted work, and I can assure you that Lolita is more than ten times as long as that excerpt.
You’re right! It still requires more content to be copyright compliant because the FAQ says, “in all cases, your writeup must be 2/3 original material .“ As it is now the quoted content is 44%.

2005.7.3@2:11 [Ikura] says Okay, then. I added some stuff on etymology that should satisfy that desire, too. As a matter of curiosity, exactly how are pipelinks counted w/r/t calculating percentages of content?

Thank you Ikura. It looks good at 32%:) If you would like to you may append this hardlink [CST Approved] . At this time the [Content_Salvage] team does not count pipe links as a part of the total word count. [GouchyOldMan] would be the best person to ask.

Writeup Title:[House, MD]
Author:[ckinni]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: Creative Commons License.
Original Author's Permission received?: Yes
Quoted content less than 33%: See notes.
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: Hello [ckinni], unfortunately the episode guide is under copyright. The best thing to do would be to rewrite them in your own words. I would like to suggest removing them from the write up until then so that your very good review of the series can stay in the database. You may want to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for some suggestions and ideas. If you have any questions please feel free to ask. Please let me know what you decide. I’ll check back in 24 hours. If nothings changed it will have to be removed.

2005.6.28@18:31 ckinni says I will temporairly remove it, however considering I was the one who edited every one of thoes guides from one or two word descriptions, can't I put it here too?

Thank you! In your sources you may want to explicate that you are the author of the episode guide in the write up since there are a lot of [http://tinyurl.com/aygwp|web sites] claiming copyright. You may also want to append this hard link [CST Approved] . :)

Author:[ v3rgez]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.

Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2005.6.26@4:27 [Maylith] says Found case of plagiarism. ORIGINAL (so far as I can tell) source = [http://www.recipesource.com/ethnic/asia/chinese/szechuan-stir-fry1.html]. Copied, E2 node = [Szechuan Stir-Fry]
Hello v3rgez, Unfortunately this [http://www.recipesource.com/text/ethnic/asia/chinese/szechuan-stir-fry1.txt|recipe] comes from a software program titled MasterCook II and is under [http://www.chsscout.net/rescenter/docs/cookrec.shtm|copyright]. You may want to read through [US Copyright for Recipes] for suggestions and ideas then resubmit it. If you have any questions I would be more than happy to help.

It may be freely reproduced, translated or adapted, even without mentioning the source.” [CST Approved]. 23 June, 2005.

Author: [Pseudo_Intellectual]

Howdy P_I, I bet you dread hearing from me huh? Somebody requested that we review this one and I got the short straw. What bits of this are quoted and what's original?
2005.6.22 (6 hr) [Pseudo_Intellectual] says re: Fugue on the Cessation of Scrambled Angst at the Sugar Refinery -- I hate to "disappoint", but the only unoriginal text there is half of the brainstormed list in bold in the first paragraph, suggestions around which all following text was contrived from thin air. (Peter never let me get my paws on his half -- a parallel text incorporating all the same suggestions... both read simultaneously.)
/msg [Pseudo_Intellectual] [Disappointed|Au contraire mon ami], I'm delighted to find such spectacular weirdness originating from one of our own. Pls consider [CST Approved|this issued closed].
Tc = 3172, Tq = 85, %q= 3%

Writeup Title:[Downing Street Memo]
Author:[williecdog]
